characters.name: Esther
characters.summary: Jewish orphan raised by Mordecai who became Queen of Persia and courageously risked her life to save her people from Haman's genocidal plot.

characters.name: Vashti
characters.summary: Persian queen whose refusal to display herself at the king's drunken feast led to her deposition, creating the vacancy that brought Esther to the throne.

characters.name: Mordecai
characters.summary: Benjamite exile who raised Esther, uncovered an assassination plot, refused to bow to Haman, and became second to the king after Jewish deliverance.

characters.name: Haman
characters.summary: Agagite official elevated by Ahasuerus who plotted genocide against the Jews due to Mordecai's refusal to bow, ultimately executed on his own gallows.

characters.name: Ahasuerus (Xerxes I)
characters.summary: Persian king whose volatile temper and susceptibility to counsel drives the plot—deposing Vashti, elevating Haman, then reversing course to save the Jews.

characters.name: Zeresh
characters.summary: Haman's wife who advised building the gallows for Mordecai, then prophetically warned Haman of his downfall when she learned Mordecai was Jewish.

characters.name: Hegai
characters.summary: Keeper of the king's harem who favored Esther and provided her with special beauty treatments and the best place in the house of women.

characters.name: Hatach
characters.summary: Eunuch assigned to attend Esther who served as messenger between her and Mordecai during the crisis over Haman's decree.

characters.name: Memucan
characters.summary: One of the seven princes of Persia who advised King Ahasuerus to depose Vashti and issue the empire-wide decree about male authority.

characters.name: Bigthana and Teresh
characters.summary: Two eunuchs who guarded the king's door and plotted to assassinate Ahasuerus; exposed by Mordecai and executed by hanging.

characters.name: Harbona
characters.summary: One of the king's eunuchs who pointed out Haman's gallows built for Mordecai, leading to Haman's execution on his own device.

characters.name: Ten Sons of Haman
characters.summary: Parshandatha, Dalphon, Aspatha, Poratha, Adalia, Aridatha, Parmashta, Arisai, Aridai, and Vaizatha—killed when Jews defended themselves and later hanged publicly.
